meanings.sent1: She nilled the offer to join the club.
meanings.sent2: He always nilled any suggestions for change.
meanings.sent3: The cat nilled the new food by turning away from it.
meanings.sent4: The student nilled the idea of studying during the weekend.
meanings.sent5: The toddler nilled the idea of eating vegetables by throwing a tantrum.

meanings.definition: To be unwilling or disinclined to do something.
meanings.sent1: They nilled the idea of going out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She nilled the thought of waking up early on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The dog nilled the idea of taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: He nilled the proposal to work overtime.
meanings.sent5: The child nilled the suggestion to share toys with a frown.
